profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 15:35:23 -0400.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center. Microfilmed materials must be consulted on microfilm. Contact Reference Services for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: REEL N70-10 (Ca. 150 items): Correspondence, notes on room decor, sketches, bills, and obituary notices, 1933-1962. Includes photos of his studio, of the interior of Schrafft's at 181 Broadway, N.Y.C., of the Carl Hoening house in Hoboken, of wall paintings, and of Bull and his family. Correspondents include family members, contractors, and clients William E. Schrafft and Pakistani Ambassador M. A. H. Ispaphani.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: UNMICROFILMED (ca. 0.6 ft.): Photographs, including some of Bull; drawings and paintings by an unidentified artist; an article about Bull; and a shell plaque.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reel N70-10 available at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Interior designer. Born in Norway, Bull came to New York City and executed designs for McKim, Mead, and White and other architects for the city's great mansions.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated 1969 by Arlene Taylor, a proteg√© of Bull in her youth and his caretaker in his old age.
